required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized, Double-blind (db), Placebo-controlled 18 Week Study of Linagliptin (BI 1356) in Type 2 Diabetic Patients With Insufficient Glycaemic Control on a Sulfonylurea Drug
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Parallel Group Efficacy and Safety Study of BI 1356 (5 mg Administered Orally Once Daily) Over 18 Weeks in Type 2 Diabetic Patients With Insufficient Glycaemic Control (HbA1c 7.0-10%) Despite Background Therapy With a Sulfonylurea Drug.

brief_summary.textblock: Efficacy and safety of BI 1356 compared to placebo in patients with type 2 diabetes who have insufficient glycaemic control despite treatment with a sulfonylurea drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c (Glycosylated Hemoglobin) at Week 18
primary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. The change from baseline reflects the Week 18 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent. Means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and previous anti-diabetic medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose at Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline reflects the Week 18 FPG minus the Week 0 FPG. Means are adjusted for baseline FPG and previous anti-diabetic medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Absolute Efficacy Response (HbA1c < 7%) at Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: An absolute efficacy response is defined as HbA1c < 7.0% at 18 weeks. A non-response is defined as HbA1c >= 7.0% at 18 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Absolute Efficacy Response (HbA1c < 6.5%) at Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: An absolute efficacy response is defined as HbA1c < 6.5% at 18 weeks. A non-response is defined as HbA1c >= 6.5% at 18 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With HbA1c Lowering by at Least 0.5% From Baseline at Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: An efficacy response is defined as HbA1c lowered by 0.5% or more at 18 weeks. A non-response is defined as HbA1c not lowered by 0.5% or more at 18 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mixed Model Repeated Measurements Analysis of Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. The change from baseline reflects the Week 6 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent. Means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and previous anti-diabetic medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mixed Model Repeated Measurements Analysis of Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. The change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent. Means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and previous anti-diabetic medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mixed Model Repeated Measurements Analysis of Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. The change from baseline reflects the Week 18 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent. Means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and previous anti-diabetic medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline reflects the Week 6 FPG minus the Week 0 FPG. Means are adjusted for baseline FPG and previous anti-diabetic medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline reflects the Week 12 FPG minus the Week 0 FPG. Means are adjusted for baseline FPG and previous anti-diabetic medication.

intervention.description: Placebo matching BI 1356 5mg one tablet daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
Patients between 18 and 80 years old with type 2 diabetes and insufficient glycemic control [glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c 7% to 10%)] despite therapy with a sulfonylurea drug
Exclusion criteria:
Myocardial infarction,stroke or transient ischaemic attack in last 6 months Treatment with rosiglitazone, pioglitazone, GLP-1 analogues, insulin or anti-obesity drugs in the past 3 months Impaired hepatic function Severe renal impairment Current treatment with systemic steroids Change in thyroid hormone dosage Hereditary galactose intolerance

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablet taken orally once daily

group.title: Linagliptin (BI 1356) 5.0 mg
group.description: Linagliptin 5.0 mg tablet taken orally once daily

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablet taken orally once daily

group.title: Linagliptin 5.0 mg
group.description: Linagliptin 5.0 mg tablet taken orally once daily

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c (Glycosylated Hemoglobin) at Week 18
outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. The change from baseline reflects the Week 18 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent. Means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and previous anti-diabetic medication.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set includes all randomized patients with baseline and on-treatment value of HbA1c. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablet taken orally once daily

group.title: Linagliptin 5.0 mg
group.description: Linagliptin 5.0 mg tablet taken orally once daily

measure.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c (Glycosylated Hemoglobin) at Week 18
measure.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. The change from baseline reflects the Week 18 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent. Means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and previous anti-diabetic medication.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set includes all randomized patients with baseline and on-treatment value of HbA1c. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule.

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model includes treatment and number of prior oral anti-diabetic drug as fixed classification effects and baseline HbA1c as a linear covariate

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose at Week 18
outcome.description: Change from baseline reflects the Week 18 FPG minus the Week 0 FPG. Means are adjusted for baseline FPG and previous anti-diabetic medication.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set includes all randomized patients with baseline and on-treatment value of FPG. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule.

group.description: Matching placebo tablet taken orally once daily

group.title: Linagliptin 5.0 mg
group.description: Linagliptin 5.0 mg tablet taken orally once daily

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose at Week 18
measure.description: Change from baseline reflects the Week 18 FPG minus the Week 0 FPG. Means are adjusted for baseline FPG and previous anti-diabetic medication.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set includes all randomized patients with baseline and on-treatment value of FPG. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule.

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model includes treatment and number of prior oral anti-diabetic drug as fixed classification effects and baseline HbA1c as a linear covariate

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Absolute Efficacy Response (HbA1c < 7%) at Week 18
outcome.description: An absolute efficacy response is defined as HbA1c < 7.0% at 18 weeks. A non-response is defined as HbA1c >= 7.0% at 18 weeks.
outcome.population: FAS patients with baseline HbA1c >= 7.0%. Non-completers were considered as failure imputation (NCF).

group.description: Matching placebo tablet taken orally once daily

class.title: HbA1c not lower by at least 0.5%

outcome.title: Mixed Model Repeated Measurements Analysis of Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 6
outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. The change from baseline reflects the Week 6 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent. Means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and previous anti-diabetic medication.
outcome.population: FAS patients. Mixed Model Repeated Measurements (MMRM) analysis of Observed Cases (OC).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablet taken orally once daily

group.title: Linagliptin 5.0 mg
group.description: Linagliptin 5.0 mg tablet taken orally once daily

measure.title: Mixed Model Repeated Measurements Analysis of Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 6
measure.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. The change from baseline reflects the Week 6 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent. Means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and previous anti-diabetic medication.
measure.population: FAS patients. Mixed Model Repeated Measurements (MMRM) analysis of Observed Cases (OC).

analysis.method_desc: MMRM with treatment, number oral anti-diabetic drugs, week within patients, week-treatment interaction and baseline HbA1c as a linear covariate.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
